item.description:
WPI’s Bioengineering Institute Symposium Series: Neuroprosthetics 2010
When: November 3 from 7:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.
Where: WPI Bioengineering Institute
100 Institute Road
Worcester, MA
Register: http://www.wpi.edu/ac...
Neuroprosthetics 2010 is an international symposium featuring leading clinicians and scientists from Europe and the United States who are at the forefront of research and development of next-generation implantable artificial limbs. The program will focus on the twin challenges of osseointegration and soft-tissue regeneration. The symposium is organized by the WPI Bioengineering Institute with support from the John Adams Innovation Institute. The Massachusetts Life Sciences Center is an organizational co-sponsor of this event. Neuroprosthetics 2010 will feature presentations from: Horst Aschoff, MD, head of reconstructive surgery at SANA-Clinics in Luebeck, Germany; Gordon Blunn, PhD of London Central University Centre for Bio-Medical Engineering; and Wolfgang Plitz, MD, PhD, from the Laboratory of Biomechanics and Experimental Orthopedics, Munich, Germany.
item.name: WPI’s Bioengineering Institute Symposium Series: Neuroprosthetics 2010
